page.title: 08Communications in Harberton
page.content: The majority of people have telephones and regular postal deliveries. Only residents in the village have the opportunity of having newspapers delivered, although many do not take a daily paper because of cost. Two weekly local papers are available, along with one free monthly "glossie" both parish and local organisation news can be found in the monthly Parish Magazine. A small percentage of households own a computer, mainly for entertainment but some for work or education. Farmers are beginning to use computers in their work. The travelling library visits the village once a fortnight and is regarded as essential by non car users.
